meanings.definition: An attractive combination of vitality and glamour.
meanings.sent1: The party decorations had a pizzazz touch with colorful balloons.
meanings.sent2: She wore a pizzazz dress to the event, catching everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The pizzazz cupcakes were the star of the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: Her smile added a pizzazz sparkle to the group photo.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks lit up the sky with pizzazz brilliance.

meanings.sent1: The team's performance had a pizzazz that energized the crowd.
meanings.sent2: Her dance routine lacked pizzazz and enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful pizzazz brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: The music festival was filled with pizzazz and excitement.
meanings.sent5: His speech lacked the pizzazz needed to captivate the audience.

meanings.definition: A quality of being exciting or attractive.
meanings.sent1: The movie lacked the pizzazz to keep the audience engaged.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit had a pizzazz that made heads turn.
meanings.sent3: The magician added pizzazz to his tricks with colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night had a pizzazz that was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The fashion show was full of pizzazz and style.
